Reviews.Title: “i just loved it and i am really picky !!! nice place and great people ! go !”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: as you cans ee in my reviews i am really picky and discerning but this place was really a pleasant surprised. i expected the worst and got maybe not the best but something really good. i booked over despegar.com and got a great price, like 47 us with breakfast. the hotel is kind of 80s and not the most modern but rooms are huuugeeeeeeeee, come with free bottled water and bifg beds and... gorgeous view over mexico city. the best thing is the location. you just take the metro from benito juarez airport to hidalgo and ploppp there is the hotel. just a 20 min ride for 3 pesos !!! (30 cents),the staff is really and not artificially friendly. something i havent even seen in 600bucks per night hotels in los angeles or nyc. they are respectful and smiles are genuine. breakfast is just abundant....so bountiful. typical mexican.you can have everything from cake to complete meals ,all included in the room. enchiladas,crepes,meat,sincronizadas,tacos name it...the make it. again.respectful and well educated staff.american hotels could learn from this,really ! only 3 flaws: internet on floor 11 doesnt ever work and water was missing 2x. not funny but they tried at least to fix it. and number 3:they have a jacuzzi on the roof top but it was closed because of re arranging their artifcial lawn :)without this an excellent choice. ahhh about the location, you can walk to zocalo,the antique main square in 10 minutes (or take a train) and as well to chapultepec castle (a must !!!! ) in 30 minutes or another train. great hotel .will be back in september. really !!!! i love mexico !

Reviews.Title: “Handy but pretty basic”
Reviews.Author: anonKingston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a group tour. It was very convenient for shops and sights and slap bang next to the Metro, but some of our group complained of noisy rooms - don't get one facing the road and heliport opposite. We a had large room, most things worked apart from the heating and staff were friendly, although the reception desk was often very busy and you do need to be able to speak Spanish as no other language seems to be spoken, unusual for a hotel in a capital city. Great breakfasts, lovely fresh omelettes and a good range of Mexican/standard Western fare. If you want a convenient budget hotel, this wouldn't be a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap price”
Reviews.Author: GuruTour
Reviews.Content: Just choose this hotel for: good location , good price, safe, also not far from zocalo about 20 min. walk, but you get what you pay, wi fi internet never works in this place but you can go to any star bucks coffee shop with your laptop, also taxi service twice expensive as normal, this hotel in the list of recommended hotels for Guru Tour travellers

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel stays in my life.”
Reviews.Author: Alex N
Reviews.Content: Although most of the staff was friendly, the hotel itself suffers from MANY disadvantages. The place itself is decrepit. The Internet connection barely works - if it works at all. The entire structure is in decay - there wasn't a single floor in the building that wasn't inclined. The carpets were dusty. The menu choices for the "included" breakfast were narrow. The windows don't close fully. The front desk staff is wonderful until you have a problem - then they go into a condescending tone that doesn't waver, even when their mistakes are so obvious even they have to admit them. I know Mexico City originally was a swamp, but they could have done a lot better in maintaining that building. Be careful when checking out - they will try to sneak charges into the bill like "lost keys" which you returned; use your cameraphone and take a picture of the person receiving them from you, as they might say you "lost" the key and charge you for it. The electrical outlets are a bit "wobbly", be careful plugging things into them. The air conditioner is noisy - but it helps mask the noise from car horns, police sirens and road work being done right outside the building. The location is good - a lot of things nearby, and a metro station; still, you should stay away from this place if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was nice that was worth the price we had pay”
Reviews.Author: Lady_judgement
Reviews.Content: We had stayed for two days at Hotel Fontan in the last week of March on our planned tour to Mexico. We would recommend this hotel to everyone, mainly to the travelers who need to balance an extent of luxury with affordability. Our room offered a cozy accommodation for both of us. Our room was very clean and its bathroom too was equally clean. Hotel staffs were average with their hospitality however we did not find anything to complain of.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cheap, Good Quality, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: pinkba
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Mexico City for the U2 Concert on May 2011, we chose this hotel because there's a Metro Station just across the street and we could get to the Estadio Azteca and a lot of other interesting places really easily. We loved the location, cause we could walk to Bellas Artes (3 blocks) the ZÃ³calo (about 9 blocks away) and a lot of very interesting downtown spots. We were also impressed because the price also includes breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “barely worth the 50 dollars night”
Reviews.Author: fontanero
Reviews.Content: Good location, a lot of noise, somewhat decrepit. As usual in Mexico, everything moves on tips most noticeable in the "included" buffet, and I had the need to get very early in the morning and I was charged half a day extra for the convinience.. Never in the US.

Reviews.Title: “average, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lj944
Reviews.Content: Negative: Only glass, so very noisy and cold. Dirty carpets. Positive: Friendly staff, safe present

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bitalala
Reviews.Content: Was a guess for four nights last december.Room very clean and nice furnished.Excellent bathroom with a very large shower stall. My room was in the second floor with a view to Reforma ave and the trafficc noise didnt bother my sleep.Temperature at night was very cold .When I complained to the guy in the front desk he offered a portable heater.I can say that I had a pleasant staying at the Fontan and the rate of $39.00 was excellent.I recommend this hotel for location,cleaniness and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: anne_lune
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during my winter holidays at Mexico City. If you are looking for a hotel with a good location, this is the hotel, because is conviniently located 10 minutes away from the downtown and the nearest subway station (Hidalgo) is just on the opposite corner of the hotel. Furthermore, the hotel rooms are clean and well equipped; my room had a great view to Reforma avenue, however, the window had a filtration of air that made really cold my room by night; luckily, there was an extra blanket. The staff of front desk is friendly and helpful and you can ask them to storage your baggage after you have done your check out in case you have some extra visits you want to make, like i did. A really convinient hotel to visit Mexico City and enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “nice price but pitiful front desk”
Reviews.Author: chinobalam
Reviews.Content: booked a week through hotels.com. attractive price (40% off rack rates). however, once you show up, the front desk will attempt to pawn off the worst rooms in the hotel...namely, the ones that face Reforma. while the rooms are large, the single pane windows do not close completely and let in an ungodly amount of noise. so beware...don't take any rooms that end in 19-27 or 01-04. see if you can get a room in the back and higher up. at first, i didn't believe the comments about the rude front desk...until we had a problem. not a pleasant experience...condescending and in serious need of an attitude adjustment. the same can be said for most of the doormen. ivan was the lone exception. he was genuinely happy to be at work and to help out in any way possible. as for the wifi, it's only reliable if you're in the lobby. never got more than three bars (out of five) for signal strength in the rooms...and usually had to connect w/ the signal from a floor or two above or below. NEVER was able to connect on the same floor...strange. other than the above three points, the hotel is conveniently located a half block from the Hidalgo metro stop. the bathrooms are newly tiled and have either tub/shower combo or large shower stalls. the towels are large and plush. free use of in-room safe. heavy drapes. large closet but insufficient lighting to easily find items. crude ironing board but okay iron. good hairdryer. if you do decide to book, do so through their website. double occupancy is only $8 more and includes a breakfast buffet...a nice plus. any other travel web site will only secure a european plan (no breakfast) and sneers from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: chrisf29
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It was clean, comfortable and in a great location, just steps away from the Hidalgo metro stop. We got a 50% discount from another website, so i was very happy with the room for the price we paid. The only problem was the room got very cold at night, but we got a heater from reception and we were toasty the second night. A nice hotel, and they give you shampoo and lotion and all that stuff too.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location, very polite staff.”
Reviews.Author: Pdx30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value. I included the breakfast buffet with my room reservation. I would recommend this option to everyone except lactose intolerant vegetariansâ€™ like myself. The dinning room staff was very helpful with answering questions about ingredients in the food. There's just is such a small selection it's better to find a more accommodating cafe in the Zona Rosa. My room lacked a bit on the cleanliness but nothing too disturbing. There was only one issue that I had during my stay. The problem is that I booked a room with a Queen bed and was put in a room with two very uncomfortable twin beds. When I went downstairs to explain this to the receptionist I was told that all their rooms were full and they would attempt to move me if a room became available. Well this never happend. So other than that my stay was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and an amazing value”
Reviews.Author: Lch86
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Mexico City and my second stay at Hotel Fontan. You cannot find a better deal anywhere. Affordable is an understatement. 5 nights here cost my friend and I $80 each. Besides the price, the hotel itself is beautiful. Clean, great restaurant, rooftop bar, comfortable and modern rooms, and the staff is unbelievably friendly. The hotel is also in a great location. The subway is down the street, the Alameda is about a block away, it's a short walk to Bellas Arted and the Zocalo. There's nothing I would change about the hotel, other than I hope it stays a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: RobinFlying
Reviews.Content: It's not bad if you don't have high expectations. My rate was ~$30/night and I got my money's worth. Most of the staff is friendly - Edgar the Concierge was very helpful. One old crone behind reception and one cranky bellboy, but everyone else fine. They change the sheets every 3 nights, and the towels are like sandpaper; my 2nd floor room was on the street so sleep w/a pillow over my head to drown out the sirens, car alarms and squealing bus tires. The breakfast buffet was not worth it, go to the Starbucks across the street. The hotel is walkable to all Centro Historic sites, and the free fast wifi was a hit with me. If you need something slight more upscale, try the Melia which is just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThinkYUM
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a travel package site, and the room ended up costing just $25 a night. We stayed there for 7 nights. The sheets and towels weren't exactly clean, but we brought our own towels. The location is excellent - it's 2 minutes of walking from the Hidalgo subway station, and 20 minutes of walking from Zocalo square. The shower and toilet started leaking after a few night's use, but were promptly fixed. Rooms were a bit noisy at night, we could hear chatting next-door as well as the traffic outside. The internet connection didn't always work. Front desk staff speak English and have been very helpful. The buffet breakfast was great. Overall I think this is a decent hotel for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and secure”
Reviews.Author: muysatisfied
Reviews.Content: The Fontan hotel offers all the ammenities that a luxury hotel offers at one third of the cost . The staff is excellent , helpful, and friendly. The restaurant has one of the best menusand very good food. at very reasonable prices. I had read reviews and I was skeptical to stay. But is no different from any other luxury hotel Thed only thing it is has a little older structure., But then again it is not what matters during a stay. I feel it is a very minor unaffectable situation that reduces the price significantly . This hotel is very secure, comfortable with a great friendly, clean and knowledgeable staff. Location could not be better in Mexico city I would highly recommend this Fontan Hotel

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay at the Hotel Fontan again.”
Reviews.Author: Capricorn49
Reviews.Content: Thank fully we were only at this hotel for one night. Based on our experience with our room I wouldn't recommend the hotel. It was extremely noisy with loud street noise until the wee hours and we could hear some guy coughing up a lung, probably in the next room. The room itself seemed clean enough but is dated and unattractive, and the bathroom is incredibly tiny. On the plus side, the buffet breakfast in the hotel dining room was quite good, and I wasn't dissatisfied with the wait staff or reception staff either. If you arrive late be aware that you may not be able to find anything to eat within several blocks of the hotel since it is in the business district. We arrived at 9:30 pm and shortly after went out looking for dinner, or at least a relaxing glass of wine and a snack. However, beiing in the business district we found that restaurants nearby were either closed or were about to close, We returned to the hotel and discovered that the dining room was also closed but the hotel staff suggested the hotel bar to us. We checked it out and discovered a brightly lit, ugly and tattered room with blaring music, and not a soul in sight aside from the guy who was working there. A very uninviting scene.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - they are liars and cheaters and its a two-bit hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwhitehill
Reviews.Content: Asked for three rooms next to each other - two with two beds, one with king size bed. Was offered rooms on two floors and refused. Then offered three rooms at ends of one floor, none with a king bed. Refused third key and took only 2 rooms. Then they charged me for 6 nights in the 3rd room I never took. When I complained at check out the night before, the manager was never available till after we had to leave. No one would go with me to look at 3rd room and prove we were never there. Then they lied about it to expedia.com and mastercard. Shower never got hot only got lukewarm for first shower in morning. Bus and car honking and loud noises on main street till 3-4am. Kids had view of parking garage. Every day maid service would take all the towels, had to ask for them. When you asked for a taxi rate, it was double what the taxi's charged across the street. They say you get free bottled water, but maids tried to refill water bottles from tap - easy to tell if the cap is not attached correctly. Internet only worked in one room and then very slowly and poorly - 1/10 the speed of internet cafe nearby. Can't say enough about people knowingly trying to cheat you.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SanFranVoyageur
Reviews.Content: Aside from ongoing elevator renovation, the lobby and restaurant looked promising, but the rooms were a big disappointment. We paid $50 for a room that was similar to rooms in DF for $30 or less. This must be our 20th time in DF, so we've stayed at many hotels; this was probably the worst value. Our first room had a clogged toilet, for which we waited, bags unpacked, for 20 minutes until I personally requested a plunger from the floor maid. No luck. 20 minutes later a plumber did arrive, but he was only successful in spilling filthy water over the bathroom floor and into the carpeting. So 40 minutes after arrival , we were switched to another room. The furnishings are from the 60s but the thin carpet appeared new. Some floors were renovated (including ours) but poorly. For example, the original, now shaky aluminum windows, do not seal out weather or noise (but they do open) and finish work was poor. The rooms could use new furnishings; the bathroom better lighting. My overall impression is that this hotel was once a choice hotel in the 50s or 60s, but it has suffered from lack of investment and maintenance. We have also stayed at the following lower price options that are superior in every aspect: the Metropol, the Hidalgo, the Catedral and the Marlowe. These hotels are immaculate, well maintained and upgraded for less money. The Hidalgo on Santa Veracruz is half the price with cheerfully modern rooms and baths.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad.”
Reviews.Author: Jodeskee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 2 nights during the first week of Swine Flu outbreak. Because of this, we got the hotel for very cheap (approx. A$40 per night). I thought it to be adequate for what we needed, a clean room close to everything. The rooms were very large with all the usual amenities (wifi etc). I would actually have compared our room to what I would expect from a 3.5 to 4 star hotel. The front desk were very helpful as well as the concierge and we didn't have any problems as everyone spoke perfect english. There was a bit of noise from the street below however you don't stay at a hotel in the middle of the city excepting it to be quiet. The only issue was room service. Because of the Swine Flu, all restaurants (including the hotels) were closed during our stay in Mexico City so we had to order room service. It was horrible! It was the worst food I've ever eaten. However, having said that, it could have been only because of the Swine Flu outbreak and they weren't able to get any quality ingredients so I'm reluctant to say ever have room service at this hotel. Overall, a good and comfortable stay during a very difficult time...except for the room service.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat basic or even "Primitive"”
Reviews.Author: ovni842
Reviews.Content: I stayed at "Fontan" for 6 nights, I found the hotel to be basic and very noisy (traffic on Reforma). As I was from Australia it was essential that good communications were vital to the success of my trip. The "Fontan" was unbelievely hopeless in the communication area they even had difficulty in connecting local calls. Most of the staff (except "Pepe" the busboy who was absolutely brilliant and infact was the only redeeming feature at this hotel) seemed confused and disinterested by even the simplest and the most basic of requests. I stayed in room 1703 on 7th floor next to the lift shaft, and for a good portion of my stay they were working on and jackhammering the wall between my room and the lift, I even took video footage of the noise and the workers jackhammering the wall, absoluteley unbelevable! noise, dust, and indifference. I did an earlier trip 8 months before and stayed at the "Regente" on Col Paris and I found this hotel to be far, far, better value and the management and staff to be far more switched on and aware of the needs and reqirements of their guests. The scores read "Regente" 8/10 the "Fontan" 4/10.

Reviews.Title: “best value in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: junglyhh
Reviews.Content: I am a little worried when I read the negative comments here after I make the reservation. In fact this hotel is far better than my expectation. It satisfies all of your basic needs. And the room is very clean. The only thing that bothers me is itÂ´s a bit noisy at night, but you can choose a room facing the Alameda Park. The Centro Historico is within walking distance, and the metro station Hidalgo is very closed to the hotel. We end up paying around $10 per night for a standard room at a convenient location, what can we complain?

Reviews.Title: “Better then I thought”
Reviews.Author: MelodyKelly
Reviews.Content: They are renovating the whole hotel, and right when you walk in it looks great the bell man was right there to get our bags, and check in was a breeze. They were doing a little construction on the elevators but it wasn't that big of a deal. They still had one working one. When we got up to the room we had a very nice room, it was a very modern design, and had a great view. Bathroom was renovated. The room had a good t.v. with both spanish and english speaking channels. They have a channel that is great its called the American Network and has all your favorite shows form the U.S. (David Letterman, SNL, Food Network stuff, Jeopardy ect...) They also had CNN and FOX! It was great. Very big room. Plus it had a great air conditioner. One night I woke up with a headache and feeling faint and my boyfriend went down to the front desk and the bell man offered to get us some cold water-bottles and medicine it was so nice. It was 2:30 in the morning. The staff was very nice, and gave us good directions around town. I highly recommend this place. If you are easy going and like to have a good time. You will like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Price-Value”
Reviews.Author: mvecchi4
Reviews.Content: I only stayed in this hotel for 1 night, but I was able to use and see many of the hotel services. The staff is helpful and friendly (although most of them didn't speak any english), The room was very good (for what I paid) and the room service was rather fast (although a little costly). Overall, the hotel is very good in terms of location, services, rooms, and staff. It is just 1 block away from a Metro Station (Hidalgo Station) from where you can go to most of the city's landmarks (sanving you lots of money, 1 ride in the subway costs 2 pesos) and is very close to the Zocalo (less than 10 minutes and an 60 pesos ride in a Taxi) There is some remodeling going on but I didn't seem to interfere with my stay, I did hear some hammering at areound 9am when I was just about to leave for my tour. I truly recommend it and if I go to Mexico City again I would definetly go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Freezing!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmfel1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel in 2008 for 3 nights over the christmas holiday Stayed here because of the central location and really cheap rates!! However, do not expect to get any service if you can't speak spanish! Some staff spoke very limited english - which was next to no help! Also don't expect to get any sleep - the rooms were absolutely freezing (I had to sleep in track pants and a jumper and requested extra blankets!!) The rooms were also extremely noisy (we could actually hear people's conversations on the street below - not to mention the constant traffic noise and police sirens). I would only recommend this place because of the central location - very safe to walk around during the day but not at night. In fact we didn't go out or do much at night because the hotel staff warned us (in what limited english they could speak) that it was very unsafe!

Reviews.Title: “are you serious?????”
Reviews.Author: IndyMexicotraveler
Reviews.Content: check in was hassle free. our room was clean. our room faced the alley,and at all hours of the night a taco stand in the alley would blast music . in the morning, there was NO HOT WATER!!after touring the city, we retierd to our room to settle in for a good nights rest.WRONG!!! the taco stand had its music on full volume at an ungodly hour of the night.we had to pack up our belongings and tranfer to a quieter room. next morning no hot water again.the front desk admited to having problems with the water heater. on our final morning at 6 am we were able to get a hot shower, only to be told to turn on the water in the sink and in the shower and then be hung up on! when we checked out, we complained about the water only to be told we could write it in thier coment book but no discount for our inconviences.

Reviews.Title: “very affordable accomidations”
Reviews.Author: teachart10
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on more recent reviews. My family stayed for one night on New Years Eve. I expected far worse from the reviews. My family and I thought the hotel was great! We were tired from a bus ride from San Miguel and an outing to the nearby zocolo. I only heard faint fireworks in the distance from the New Year celebrations. The staff was friendly and spoke english. We ate dinner close to the zocolo but wished we had eaten dinner at the hotel. The breakfast, the next day, was really good! It was just what we needed to start the long journey back to the east coast. There are renovations going on, but we didn't let this distract us from the overall cleanliness of the hotel. My only complaint is that I got totally jipped from a taxi that one of the employees from the hotel put us in to go to the airport. The short trip cost a total of 150.00 pesos. Hail your own taxi for about 37.00 pesos!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: LarryWastoday
Reviews.Content: OK, it isn't great but it isn't terrible either. And considering that we got an amazingly low rate online, it must be considered good value for money. The rate did not include breakfast. The main thing going for it is its location. A 5 minute walk from the Almenida square with its shops, hotels and restaurants. From there you can take the metro and go to the Zocalo, though you should consider the 25 minute walk: worth it. I could be wrong but I got the impression that the quality of the rooms varies between the floors. We were on the "cheap" floor. The room was large enough, simply decorated and clean enough. The finishing was quite poor and there were bits and pieces not working as they should. Staff replaced one of the light bulbs as soon as we told them. One of the two lifts was not working (completely gutted, quite unsightly) and the other would not stop at our floor unless we kept pressing the call button. The rate did not include car parking but the hotel was doing valet parking and the car park is just on the other side of the road. One mistery that we are yet to solve is the address: once you reach the house number where the hotel should be, you have to go some 4-500 yards further. If we were to go back to Mexico city, we would probably stay elsewhere (we prefer the Best Western Estoril) but for what we paid, it would be unfair to complain too much

Reviews.Title: “OK property to spend a few nights”
Reviews.Author: dmlandis
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fontan was an average property. Great location - 1/2 a block from Hidalgo Metro station as well as Avenida Juarez and Alameda Park. My room was quiet but sparsely furnished. There was a comfortable enough bed but no clock radio or city information. The hallways were dark and there was maintenance on the elevators. The rooms could definitely be upgraded and have more amenities put in. On the plus side, the breakfast buffer (99 pesos) was very good with great selection of fruits, entrees, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location...a little noisy.”
Reviews.Author: carloswill
Reviews.Content: Great value... a little noisy. I cant believe some of the other reviews. I paid $35 online and felt like I got a really good deal. The walk up rate was more than twice the online rate. The room was nicely decorated and exceptionally clean. There is rarely a need for heat... so the room was a little cool... but the staff brought me extra blankets the moment I requested them. Overall, the staff was professional, friendly, knowledgable and multi-lingual. The location cant be beat for a budget traveler... steps from the best subway lines in the city. 15 cents per trip. Lots of dining choices nearby and convenience stores and internet cafes. This hotel is ON Reforma Blvd... so it is safe at all hours... but it is also quite noisy at all hours, especially the lower level rooms. If you are a light sleeper, do your research and find something in a quieter area.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous experience, couldn't wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: viajera511
Reviews.Content: The best thing that this hotel has going for it is its location. It is right next to the Hidalgo Metro and walking distance from the Alameda Central, Palacio de Bellas Artes, and Zocalo in the historic district of Mexico City. The restaurant is also very good, with excellent service and a delicious breakfast (included). However, staying here requires so much patience and the incompetent and unhelpful hotel staff make staying here an absolute nightmare. The room was clean enough, but because you are located on Mexico City's main boulevard, there is a constant roar outside that makes it very hard to sleep soundly. We had issues with our bathroom plumbing and it took 3 days for them to change our rooms. The most frustrating aspect of the hotel is that you are unable to make outside phone calls. You have to call the operator and tell her the number you want to call and she will make the call for you. This system is inefficient and archaic. She continuously put me on hold and took 10-15 minutes to even dial the number. Sometimes she took down the number wrong, so I had to call back and repeat it. Meanwhile, you are being charged for all the wrong numbers, whether or not it's your fault. It took a full day for me to find a way to make an emergency-related international call from the hotel and finally I had to sit with the operator at her desk and dial from there. The staff was unable to understand and respond to the urgency of my situation. They were unapologetic and unhelpful. I will say that the hotel was also hosting members of a huge international conference during my stay, so they were stretched, but given the nature of all the other reviews, I would say that it's safe to say that this hotel is one that everyone should pass on.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: carefulraveler
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The location was good, next to a metro station. There were good food and drink vendors close by. There were some times without hot water, but it was usually nice and hot in the mornings. The room was chilly but not unbearable. Out leaky toilet was repaired while we were there, without our asking! I felt safe and comfortable and would stay there again. The quality of the hotel and staff was much better than I expected for the price!

Reviews.Title: “I can dig this joint yes I can”
Reviews.Author: DriveGoddess
Reviews.Content: Well I had booked this hotel before I even checked the reviews and after reading them they sort of smacked of amateur travelers who did not know much about hotels outside of their particular comfort zones. This is my second night here - I have one more night and because there is so much to do here I may add an extra night, space permitting. I recommend folks to try to get a room on the eighth floor, balcony section because it does have views of Alameda Park and that crazy horse sculpture on Reforma. I have nice hot water and I can get the net via my wireless. Now I had to cajole the good folks who work here to get a password, the manager came to my room to see that yes I could get a connection so he set me up good. This hotel is yes, dated decor wise but I am not staying here for the decor. The free breakfast hits the spot and nearby are good cheap eats, a farmacia, a convenience store, a Sanborns and of course the main drag, Reforma which is interesting in itself. The TV has some english channels and CNN and Fox in english. For the price and location you do quite well. This hotel attracts business travelers and as one I have found the staff to be very helpful especially since I walk with a cane and have a hard time getting around. I have stayed in all sorts of hotel worldwide and I would stay here again just because of the staff. Very conscientious folks indeed. Heck, not a bad place at all. I take most reviews with a grain of salt but when I read the negative ones I had to respond from my seasoned perspective. Thanks for allowing me this opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Wouln't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: gsbpt
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid was ok. I wouldn't go back anyway. I stayed there 5 days on holiday with my boyfriend, we didn't have hot water many times, the room was small and old fashioned, but at the end we just sleeped there. At the front desk not really friendly. The buffet was ok, friendly waiters. The most impressive part of the staff were the bell boys, they went one night to find a bottle of wine for us and even cigaretts and they brought them to our room (for a quite big tip anyway). If you are there to visit the town, outside the hotel there's always "Ubaldo", it's a 50 years old man that is like a tour guide. It's not cheap, but he brings you where you want and he explains you everything. Or instead there is an office in the hotel that sells trips, not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “checked out within 2 hours!”
Reviews.Author: happyberks
Reviews.Content: We arrived and it took us 15 minutes to check-in. The process was very simple complete the form and get your key but as soon as a Mexican walked into reception we were ignored until they were assisted. When we arrived on our floor the lights were not on but discovered that they were on a sensor, which is good for the environment but not good for guests who have rooms down the end of the corridor because when you leave your room you have to walk back to the lift in darkness before you can trip the only sensor! I could open my door with my colleagues key we accidentally discovered much to our horror. The room itself was very dated, if you like very bright pink then maybe it is for you but the paint has been slapped onto very old wallpaper so you can image the quality of the finish. The furniture was basic to say the least and the bed was a disgrace. The toilet bowl was cracked as was the sink. But the worst point was that the window was single glazed, the window latch was broken so the window couldn't close and we were on a very busy street ( I know they are all busy in Mexico City! ). There is no air conditioning and in you want to use their wireless facility you need to be on either the 3rd or 9th floor! They also have no safes in the room and the TV reception is non-existent. We exited the hotel very quickly to find another local hotel and finally found a room at the local Sheritan (I can highly recommend this one!) before heading back to the Fontan to check out. On our way back up to our rooms we got stuck in the lift for 10 minutes, fortunately a member of staff was in there with us and could radio for help!!! This hotel did not feel safe - the windows wouldn't shut, you could open rooms with the wrong keys and their was no safe - for a city with such high crime we did not feel safe. If you are travelling to Mexico city do not book here, if you already have booked it cancel now!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: jbeltran
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok for a room to sleep in (a little run down). The rooms did not have AC nor heating and there was even one morning were there was no hot water. I would not stay there again.
